results.title: My valley is changing
results.creator_credit: Roland Beckett, John Martin-Jones, David Haythornthwaite, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Lionel Hudson
results.brief_description: Shows how the people of Bougainvillea are reacting to the changes brought about by the mining operations. They are finding it difficult to adapt but copper export means income for the whole territory and provides jobs and training for people eager for independence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roland Beckett, John Martin-Jones, David Haythornthwaite, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Lionel Hudson

results.title: My uncle = Mon oncle [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Louis Dolivet, Specta, Fray, Alterdel-Centaure and Jacques Tati
results.brief_description: Mon Oncle is a poetic satire depicting man against machine, rather in the manner of Chaplin’s “Modern Times” and Rene Clair’s “A Nous la Liberte”. Hulot is little Gerard Arpel’s uncle, a fond relative whose whimsical ways fail to impress the boy’s ultra-modern parents. What transpires is a masterpiece of design which develops Tati’s unique comic vision without ever losing sight of the essential simplicity he holds so dear. Deft, elusive, full of heart, “Mon Oncle” is a film to see again and again. Winner of Academy Award for Best Foreign Film. Also available on VHS [301867].

results.title: My turtle died today
results.brief_description: In this first-person story, a boy recalls the death of a pet. His father, his teacher, and the pet-shop owner are unable to help his sick turtle, and it dies. This story creates an opportunity for discussion of the inevitability of death and the continuity of life. Adapted from the Little Owl book.

results.title: My truth
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Vladimir Keca and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vladimir Keca lived a sheltered life in a remote part of the former Yugoslavia with his grandparents. But once war broke out, he was removed from his comfort zone and, while it changed everything, Keca is not so sure that it was all bad.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Vladimir Keca and ACMI

results.title: My time again - Richard Burton
results.brief_description: Richard Burton talks about how he became an actor, and discusses the art of acting for stage and screen with Michael Elwyn who is, like Burton, a Welsh actor who moved towards professional acting while a member of the Oxford University Dramatic Society.

results.title: My tiger's eyes
results.creator_credit: Teck Tan and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: The conservative anti-Communist era of the 1950’s, the Cold War and the “Reds under the bed” - in Sydney, Australia, a young Chinese boy grows up and the Irish/Australian neighbours suspect his family might very well be Communists. The paranoia of the O’Hallorans takes on a comic twist when the boy’s Uncle Walter arrives in the country. A refugee from the Chinese Communist Revolution, the O’Hallorans take him for a Communist spy instead. Seen through the not-so-innocent eyes of 10 year-old Robert Ah Louey, the film captures the social attitudes of the 1950’s, the cultural nuances of neighbours on either side of the fence, and in the process saying something of what it was like being Chinese in Australia during the 50’s. Cast includes Adam Gungor (Robert), Terry Woo (Uncle Walter), Genevieve Mooy (Dolores O’Halloran), Peter Whitford (Jack O’Halloran). (Awards: Special Prize, ATOM Awards, 1993; Finalist, Best Fiction Category and EAC Award, Sydney Film Festival, 1992; Nominated Best Short Film AFI Awards, 1992)

results.title: My Sweet Little Village = Vesnicko Ma Strediskova
results.creator_credit: Jan Suster, Barrandov Studios and Jiri Menzel
results.brief_description: My Sweet Little Village examines with simple affection the affairs - comic, sad, quirky and downright ordinary - of a village collective farm in Czechoslovakia. The story begins and ends with a marvellous comic pair - truckie’s offsider, Otek, and his long suffering workmate. There is not a solitary political utterance to be heard, but the film still manages to subtly convey the graft and corruption permeating every level of Czech society.

results.title: My survival as an Aboriginal
results.creator_credit: Alec Morgan, Martha Ansara, Essie Coffey and Goodgabah Productions
results.brief_description: After being forced from their tribal grounds, the Murrowarri were dumped onto a tiny reserve on the fringe of a white town. In this film Essie Coffey, black activist and musician, shows the conflicts of living as an Aboriginal under white domination. This film is part of her effort to make her community proud of their black identity while struggling to survive.

results.title: My special family
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Erin Wilson and ACMI
results.brief_description: Erin Wilson pays tribute to her special family, a family who have taught her all about life. From her family, Erin has learnt responsibility, empathy, the realities of life and death and, most importantly, love and friendship. Here she pays tribute to the members of this special family.
